title: How to Make an Origami Giraffe

steps.headline: Start with a standard 8.5" x 11" piece of paper and measure out a square piece.
steps.description: This square piece will be your starting point

steps.headline: Fold the square in half sideways so that the two side corners are touching and then unfold.
steps.description: This should create a crease down the centerline

steps.headline: Fold the side corners so that they meet at the centerline and then fold it in half
Fold the sharp point to the right making an almost vertical crease.
steps.description: This creates the neck of the giraffe.

steps.headline: Fold the top corner inside out so that the sharp point is now pointing to the right.
steps.description: This should create a sort of hood or umbrella over the neck. Hint: You may need to slightly unfold the paper to make a neat fold here.

steps.headline: Take the point at the top of the neck and fold it to the left.
steps.description: You will be making the same fold as you did for the neck portion.

steps.headline: Take the recently made fold and flip it inside out so that it looks like the above photo.
Take the left tip of the head and fold to the right, making a vertical fold.
Fold the tip inwards creating a muzzle.
This next step requires two folds.
steps.description: Take the bottom right corner and fold it to the left. Now take the tip and fold it to the left.

steps.headline: Fold the bottom corner inward and pull the tip out creating the tail.
Use the scissors to cut out a portion to create the legs.
steps.description: This completes the origami giraffe. Feel free to draw on it and get creative.

tyn: Square-shaped yellow origami paper, ideally 10 by 10 cm (3.9 by 3.9 in)
text: Start with a standard 8.5" x 11" piece of paper and measure out a square piece. This square piece will be your starting point Fold the square in half sideways so that the two side corners are touching and then unfold. This should create a crease down the centerline Fold the side corners so that they meet at the centerline and then fold it in half  Position the paper like this.  Fold the sharp point to the right making an almost vertical crease. This creates the neck of the giraffe. Fold the top corner inside out so that the sharp point is now pointing to the right. This should create a sort of hood or umbrella over the neck. Hint: You may need to slightly unfold the paper to make a neat fold here. Take the point at the top of the neck and fold it to the left. You will be making the same fold as you did for the neck portion. Take the recently made fold and flip it inside out so that it looks like the above photo. This creates the head portion. Take the left tip of the head and fold to the right, making a vertical fold.  Fold the tip inwards creating a muzzle.  This next step requires two folds. Take the bottom right corner and fold it to the left. Now take the tip and fold it to the left. Fold the bottom corner inward and pull the tip out creating the tail.  Use the scissors to cut out a portion to create the legs. This completes the origami giraffe. Feel free to draw on it and get creative.
